text.tspan: Ischaemia often happens in the lower third which has a worse blood
supply which then allows damage as the underlying cause.
Distal esophageal involvement -can extend proximally; ends sharply at the GOJ
Diffues and severe necrosis of mucosa and submucosa with no stratified
squamous cells, occasional deranged muscle fibers, hyperemia and scattered thrombosed
The lesion is initally black then
It is more common in men.
Coal dust and exogenous dye ingestion.
After prolonged vomiting following alcohol binging.
It usually occurs in the distal oesophagus in left postero-
Gastroduodenal ulcer disease is present in 40%.
The initial CXR is always abnormal in Boerhaave’s.
